info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 21 at 5:07PM EDT until July 21 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding impacts continue from earlier excessive rain. * WHERE...A portion of western Massachusetts, including the following counties, Franklin and Hampshire. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 507 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. There are a number of flooding impacts including road closures, road washouts and in some instances road damage, along with inundation in homes and businesses. It was reported that floodwaters are up to the first floor in businesses in downtown Conway. Between 3.5 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. While rain rates have lightened considerably, we are monitoring additional thunderstorms over Berkshire County in Massachusetts that may move into the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greenfield, Deerfield, Montague, Williamsburg, Bernardston, Buckland, Conway, Shelburne, Ashfield, Gill, Whately, Chesterfield, Goshen, Cummington and Leyden. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
